items.title: Alleen op papier een topper: Arsenal vermorzelt Aston Villa
items.summary: Arsenal heeft zijn status als titelkandidaat andermaal bevestigd. In de topper tegen Aston Villa was de ploeg van Mikel Arteta heer en meester: 4-1.

items.title: Dortmund lead race for Bobb - Wednesday's gossip
items.summary: Borussia Dortmund lead a number of clubs wanting to sign Oscar Bobb from Manchester City, Marc Guehi has his eye on a Real Madrid move, Juventus want Guido Rodriguez, plus more.

items.title: Arsenal v Aston Villa: Premier League ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ Premier League updates from the 8.15pm GMT kick-off ‚öΩ Live scores | Follow us on Bluesky | And email Scott 3 min: Odegaard tries to release Trossard into the Villa box down the inside-left channel. Clank. Goal kick, so another chance for the home fans to indulge their love of interactive festive theatre. 1 min: Villa work the ball back to their keeper Martinez, formerly of Arsenal. The Argentinian World Cup winner cops the expected abuse. It is pantomime season, to be fair. Continue reading...

items.title: Arsenal's Arteta: Rice knee injury only short term
items.summary: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta has said Declan Rice's knee injury is a short-term issue, although it means he miss Tuesday's top-of-the-table clash with Aston Villa.

items.title: Ronaldo wants 1k goals; open to Europe return
items.summary: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo has reiterated his desire to reach 1,000 career goals before he calls time on his playing career.

items.title: England group warns FIFA: WC fans priced out
items.summary: A fans' group says "alarm bells should be ringing" at FIFA with England's fans having failed to take up their full ticket allocation for next summer's World Cup final.

items.title: Maresca under fire again after Chelsea draw
items.summary: Chelsea's poor Premier League form extended to one win in seven games as Bournemouth held on for a 2-2 draw at Stamford Bridge.

items.title: Rangers close gap to Celtic after beating St Mirren
items.summary: Rangers closed the gap to second-placed Celtic after beating St Mirren 2-1 at Ibrox, although still remain six points adrift of Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts.

items.title: Guimar√£es shuts down Burnley‚Äôs late fightback to end Newcastle‚Äôs poor away run
items.summary: It is, ultimately, only the result that matters in football. Newcastle almost stopped playing after going two goals ahead inside seven minutes and spent the remainder of the game desperately holding on for their second away win of the season, leaving Burnley wondering what more they could have done. Burnley were dominant in all areas after the early shock, showing the spirit and grit required in a relegation battle, but the truth of the matter is they have two points from the last possible 30 and are facing an immediate return to the Championship. Josh Laurent ignited hope when there was none after Joelinton and Yoane Wissa scored, a flame that was finally put out by Bruno Guimar√£es late on. Continue reading...

items.title: Enzo Maresca jeered by Chelsea fans amid wild draw with Bournemouth
items.summary: Enzo Maresca has been talking up his relationship with Chelsea‚Äôs supporters but the love was not returned during this 2-2 draw with Bournemouth. There was open dissent from the Stamford Bridge crowd when Cole Palmer, who is still feeling his way back from a groin injury, went off midway through the second half and there was more grumbling when a wild game was over. This was another bad night for Chelsea. Maresca‚Äôs erratic side defended poorly, have one win in their past seven league games and remain incapable of capitalising on dominant spells. They have now dropped 13 points from winning positions at home ‚Äì more than any other side in the Premier League ‚Äì after being held by Andoni Iraola‚Äôs Bournemouth, who ended grateful to Antoine Semenyo giving his all in what might be his final appearance for the club before a likely move to Manchester City. Continue reading...

items.title: Celtic gaat onderuit bij Motherwell en verliest weer terrein in titelstrijd
items.summary: Celtic dacht de boel weer enigszins op de rit te hebben, maar de Schotse grootmacht kreeg dinsdag een nieuwe dreun. Het bezoek aan Motherwell leverde alweer de vijfde competitienederlaag van het seizoen op.

items.title: Wissa scores as Newcastle bag rare away win at Burnley
items.summary: Newcastle recorded just a second away win in their last 13 Premier League games with a 3-1 victory at Burnley.

items.title: VI Live: Arsenal is heer en meester tegen Aston Villa
items.summary: Dinsdag gaat het weer los in de Premier League. Koploper Arsenal ontvangt Aston Villa, dat zich lijkt te gaan mengen in de titelstrijd, en Manchester United neemt het op tegen hekkensluiter Wolverhampton Wanderers. Op de Afrika Cup zijn vier potjes, en in Schotland zetten Celtic en Rangers hun achtervolging op koploper Heart of Midlothian voort. Volg het belangrijkste voetbal van dinsdag in deze VI Live.

items.title: Barry finishes the job for Everton after Garner returns to haunt ailing Forest
items.summary: Things are beginning to get a little twitchy for Nottingham Forest and Sean Dyche. Forest have made strides under Ange Postecoglou‚Äôs successor but after a miserable defeat by Everton, Dyche‚Äôs previous club, it is now three straight defeats and a bruising January run of fixtures are on the horizon. Five of their next six matches are away, including a trip to West Ham, now only four points behind Forest. For David Moyes and his threadbare squad, this was a triumph, goals by the former Forest loanee James Garner and Thierno Barry earning a deserved victory. Forest submitted a complaint to Professional Game Match Officials, the referees‚Äô body, regarding the officiating in the defeat at home by Manchester City at the weekend. The club were adamant significant decisions counted against them and requested the audio between on-pitch officials that determined key moments. But Forest only had themselves to blame for a lethargic start against an Everton side that arrived without a victory or even a goal since the reverse fixture at Hill Dickinson Stadium almost four weeks ago. Continue reading...

items.summary: Manchester United are one of the clubs monitoring RB Leipzig winger Yan Diomande.
